block.p: LEAD: The Environmental Protection Agency gave permission last week for Allied-Signal Inc. to begin marketing a substitute for chlorofluorocarbons, a chemicial that has been found to cause damage to the earth's ozone layer. The new substance, called HCFC 141b, can replace chlorofluorocarbons, or CFC's, in solvents and foam insulation, said William M.

LEAD: The Environmental Protection Agency gave permission last week for Allied-Signal Inc. to begin marketing a substitute for chlorofluorocarbons, a chemicial that has been found to cause damage to the earth's ozone layer. The new substance, called HCFC 141b, can replace chlorofluorocarbons, or CFC's, in solvents and foam insulation, said William M.

The Environmental Protection Agency gave permission last week for Allied-Signal Inc. to begin marketing a substitute for chlorofluorocarbons, a chemicial that has been found to cause damage to the earth's ozone layer. The new substance, called HCFC 141b, can replace chlorofluorocarbons, or CFC's, in solvents and foam insulation, said William M. Corcoran, a spokesman for Allied-Signal.
